data.name: Sin Breaker Rig
data.description:
Sin Breaker Rig (SBR) is a VR first-person bullet-hell shooter. Player becomes Kanon, an ace pilot in the SBR rescue team, ready to explore this machine-dominated world.

Perform badass, anime-inspired moves to obliterate your foes. We utilize the latest hand-tracking technology, therefore all actions are done without the need of a controller. One can simply push the arm forward to release a fireball, or snap the fingers to trigger an arcanic flame that seeks nearby enemies.

We also introduce a new way to move across vast terrain. By using one's own body to induce movement, the player feels more immersed and less prone to VR sickness. You can now easily strafe to dodge incoming missiles, while firing with both hands at different directions.

changelog.change_log: Fix some localization issue. Fix issue that screen-based effects only played in one eye.

Fix issue that tutorial can't be skipped. 
Add new Ocean level (Encounter still WIP). 
Fix some display issue on tutorial slides
Fix visual error in prairie level. Upgrade big bot animation and model
Improve items readability in CloudCity and Prairie maps.
Fix some animation and material display issues.
When raising shield, player can now adjust shield's movement and direction with left hand.
Update flying tutorial to display proper warning when hovering is off.
Fix issue of falsely triggering the HoverSwitch during shielding. Moved all wrist-attached UI to right hand.

Fix numerous gesture issue for fireball throwing. 
We took the feedback from G-Eight Game Show in had made the fireball easier to throw. Also cleared the confusion when fireball sometimes appears when doing "snap" gesture.
Set control to hand-tracking only. Fix performance issue.
